Recipe.title: Dutch Oven Basque Sheepherder's Bread
Recipe.Source: Not sure where this one came from, but Grandpa John used to make it when Ransom was a kid.
Recipe.Description:
Grandpa John used to take the family on a long trip up and through Canada, then down the western coast. While in Washington or Oregon, they would stop and pick a bunch of wild blackberries then find a camping spot.
There, Gramma 'Rilla would make jam, while Grandpa John would make Basque Sheepherder's Bread. It made a wonderful treat the kids all loved!

section.instruction: Line Dutch oven with foil, then grease it with Butter or Shortening.
Combine Hot Water, Melted Butter or Shortening, Sugar, Salt, Yeast, and Flour, then kneed well.
Let rise for ≈15 minutes, then punch down.
Place in Dutch oven and mash down evenly across the bottom.
Let rise until it barely touches the lid.
Bake slowly, mostly from the top. (≈45 minutes)
Gently remove from Dutch oven and place on cutting board while removing the foil.

Notes.note: It is always good to have something to put on top of slices, like the Black Berry Jam Grandma 'Rilla used to make.
